intro: Rhynchotropis curtisiae, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Rhynchotropis curtisiae is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
